instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Backlight works but only on low
threads.message:
I'm trying to find out if there is a problem with the actual backlight or the circuit.

I'm getting around 24v on <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> until the brightness is turned up, then it jumps all over.
I don't have another assembly for this model in stock to simply try another.

What do you recon the odds are that its the actual backlight in the screen thats the issue?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Backlight works but only on low
threads.message: Had a WLED cause this on an air recently.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Backlight works but only on low
threads.message: Very likely that it is just a bad <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> or corrosion around it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Backlight works but only on low
threads.message: Thank you Duke, a gentle flux and heat of <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> (<CHIP>U7701</CHIP>) did the trick :)
